text: I don't think you can use scope_css within require_css so I would go with one or the other! I typically use require_css but give the main wrapper of my module an `id="{{ name }}"` which will allow you to then target anything in the module that is specific only to that instance of that module similar to scope but you can mix it in with global styles a little easier

The main use case I can think of is if you are applying styles from the styles tab of module fields and the module might be used more than once per page, then target with that ID above or use scope_css. If it's just your module CSS and doesn't require HubL variables or cross browser macros, put it in the CSS portion of the module.
